channel.title: !Windows 7!
channel.description: Windows 7, it's a mix between vista and xp, absolutely amazing, very awesome, my advice is to download the beta, its amazing guys tbh. (JUST GOOGLE WINDOWS 7 DOWNLOAD)

item.title: !Windows 7!
item.dc:creator: @jme jme
item.description:
@jme wrote:

[quote=“Maedie1, post:10, topic:278804”][quote author=the pker nub link=topic=367989.msg2788264#msg2788264 date=1242595301]
Windows 7 has the superbar and stuff, really easy to get to diff ways, i like it.
[/quote]
Exactly, and do you know what all that SHIT requires? To run it, you need a good 3 GigaBytes of RAM and a pretty good graphics processor. I in fact have the Beta on a partition and it’s nothing special. Just a few more features in it. Plus, all those schemes really tend to slow you down. Windows 98 and XP were the best.[/quote]

Actually it’s much better than vista for this. It runs much better than vista did.

The system requirements:

* 1 GHz 32-bit (x86) or 64-bit (x64) processor
* 512 MB of system memory
* 20 GB hard drive with at least 15 GB of available space
* Support for DirectX 9 graphics and 32 MB of graphics memory

Read full topic

item.title: !Windows 7!
item.dc:creator: @mod_taharok Taharok
item.description:
@mod_taharok wrote:

[quote=“Fat Cookies, post:19, topic:278804”][quote author=Taharok link=topic=367989.msg2792763#msg2792763 date=1242880028]
Microsoft will stop supporting XP by the end of this year iirc.
[/quote]

I wont be suprised if they extend support again since the fairly recent netbook and brand new nettop market will continue to grow at the rate it is at the moment. Microsoft were going to stop producing XP in 2007 but since they are greedy bastards and would do anything to prevent Linux being heavily exposed to the market they extended production so they can force all netbook manufactures to buy XP instead of using an open-source OS.

Bill Gates is the dictator of the comsumer personal computer market.[/quote]

Bill Gates doesn’t even work for Microsoft anymore. Keep negative comments pinned on the company, not the founders. The founders did a good job starting up a company, but they have little control over which direction and what action that company does.

Read full topic

item.title: !Windows 7!
item.dc:creator: @mod_taharok Taharok
item.description:
@mod_taharok wrote:

Windows 7 is a lot better compared to Vista. Vista always sucked dick and made Microsoft loose a ton of money. Oh well, not much more to say here. 7 is basically the Vista engine with all the unnecessary shit removed, making it a lot faster. And, unlike Vista, it doesn’t automatically allocate half the computer’s memory.

[quote="[A"]mpd link=topic=367989.msg2787152#msg2787152 date=1242545211]
No thanks. I think that I’ll stick with Windows XP.[/quote]

Microsoft will stop supporting XP by the end of this year iirc.

Read full topic

item.title: !Windows 7!
item.dc:creator: @m.dog311 m.dog311
item.description:
@m.dog311 wrote:

[quote=“Syfal, post:7, topic:278804”][quote author=m.dog311 link=topic=367989.msg2788204#msg2788204 date=1242593334]

Kihoruma, is not rsps related so its fine.
We know about Windows 7 about a year ago. You cannot download it because the beta period finished ages ago. Some members at mitb have it like Rictoo and sppt. Only reason I dont have it is because of my rubbish pc.

Dont post about things you dont know about

I got it after the beta period, and quite frankly, it’s nothing special. Vista isn’t that bad if you know how to fix the bugs when the come up (it’s not that hard). Windows 7 is going to be the same way.
[/quote]

Unless it crashes on you every 20 minutes :P[/quote]
I have Vista on 4 different computers and that happens on none of them. And most of the worst Vista problems are human stupidity. Which means the same stuff is going to happen on Windows 7.

Read full topic
